channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How algae learned to harness the Sun without getting burned
item.description: Under the sea, green algae have evolved a clever way to handle too much sunlight. Scientists found that a special pigment called siphonein acts like a...

item.description: Our Milky Way is far from calm — it ripples with a colossal wave spanning tens of thousands of light-years, revealed by ESA’s Gaia telescope. This wav...

item.title: Atlantic dolphins are dying much younger. Scientists sound the alarm

item.title: Running fixes what junk food breaks in the brain
item.description: New research reveals that exercise counteracts the mood-damaging effects of a Western-style diet through specific gut and hormonal mechanisms. Running...

item.title: A “toxic duo” may be the hidden trigger behind Alzheimer’s disease
